alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:27PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Custer County through 815 PM CDT... At 727 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Miller, or 26 miles northwest of Kearney, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mason City, Block Hill Basin, Gavin Siding and Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 85. Highway 2 between mile markers 302 and 307. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
